CONSENT DECREE by Honorable H. F. Waters dismissing case that the USDC for the WD/AR, Fort Smith Division, will retain jurisdiction over decree for purposes of enforcement & dispute resolution; further neither the negotiation of or agreement to this decree is an admission or acknowledgment by Neel's that any of its employees, officers, directors, or agents have violated Title VII & decree will be binding on the parties to this lawsuit for three years after the date of its entry by the court; further Neel's, its supervisors, managers, officers, directors, agents & successors are enjoined from sexually harassing employees; further Neel's will pay Ms. Traci Chitwood and her attorney $15,000.00 and Neel's will send payment to Ms. Chitwood's atty, Barry D. Neal, w/in 10 days after the entry of decree; further the payment will be made in the form of a check made out to "Traci Chitwood and Barry D. Neal" & copy of the payment transmittal mailed at the same time to Carson L. Owen, EEOC; further Neel's will post the notice to employees for 30 days in conspicuous places upon its premises & w/in 10 days after the entry of decree Neel's will send a letter to Carson Owen, verifying that the notice has been posted; further the policy prohibiting sexual harassment will be complied with by Neel's & each employee will be required to read and sign a copy of policy, and will be given a copy of the policy; further Neel's will submit a report to Carson L. Owen, six months after the entry of decree, and every six months thereafter during the duration of this decree and each report will describe all complaints recd from employees concerning sexual language or conduct at work, including the name, home address, and home telephone number of each employee who complained, the nature of the complaint, what action, if any, was taken in response to the complaint, and if no action was taken an explanation of why no action was taken; futher EEOC, Ms. Chitwood and Neel's will each bear their own atty's fees and costs incurred in action (cc: all counsel) (rw) (Entered: 10/27/1998)

case_data.name: EEOC v. NEEL'S FOOD SERVICE INC (d/b/a JERRY NEEL'S BAR-B-QUE)
case_data.plaintiff_description: Equal Employment Opportunity Commission, on behalf of one or more workers.
settlement_agreement: Court Approved Settlement or Consent Decree
case_data.summary:
In May 1998, the Memphis office of the EEOC brought this Title VII suit against Neel's Food Service, Inc. d/b/a Jerry Neel's Bar-B-Que in the U.S. District Court for the Western District of Arkansas. The case settled by entry of a consent decree in December 1998.

The consent decree required the defendant to pay the claimant $15,000, refrain from harassment, post notice, distribute its anti-harassment policy, and give the EEOC reports every six months pertaining to any complaints of sexual language or conduct by an employee of the defendant. No other information was made available pertaining to the consent decree or the nature of the suit.
